snippet: A ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court last week that a law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made the case less attractive to the higher court.
abstract: Supreme Court declines to hear appeal on decision striking down an Oklahoma abortion law, dismissing as 'improvidently granted' a case it had previously agreed to consider; latest ruling by Oklahoma Supreme Court that law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made case less attractive to the higher court.
lead_paragraph: A ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court last week that a law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made the case less attractive to the higher court.

headline.main: Justices Decline an Appeal on Abortion
headline.print_headline: Justices Decline An Appeal On Abortion
